ai.summary: A 6.3 km moderate hike around Cadbury Camp, an Iron Age hill fort in the UK. The route blends grassy paths, gentle ascents, and open countryside with distant views, offering a rewarding walk for those who enjoy history and scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: Combination of field paths, grassy lanes, and compact earth tracks. Expect uneven ground, occasional stiles, and mild elevations as you approach the hill fort. Ground can be muddy after rain; wear sturdy footwear.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy, supportive footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. Stay on marked paths, be mindful of livestock and gates, and watch for mud and loose stones. Carry a map and compass or GPS, a charged phone, and enough water and snacks. Let someone know your route and expected return time; be prepared for patchy phone signal in rural areas.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Water and snacks (1–2 litres of water recommended)
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight for possible late finishes
Lightweight rain cover or packable rain jacket
Fully charged mobile phone and emergency contact information
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn is ideal, when trails are drier and views clearer. The hike can be done year-round, but winter conditions may be slippery, daylight is shorter, and weather can be harsher.

seo.title: Cadbury Camp Ramble – 6.3 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan a 6.3 km moderate hike around Cadbury Camp. Learn about the terrain, safety considerations, gear recommendations, and the best seasons for hiking in the UK countryside.
